text: Cooking certainly tenderizes food, making it easier to chew and digest. But evidence for human cook fires goes back only about 500.000 years, if that. Homo erectus had already evolved weaker jaws, and smaller teeth, more than a million years before that. So Lieberman and his colleague Katherine Zink began their investigation by recreating a Paleolithic dinner: yams, carrots, beets, And goat meat.
